intro: Trichocaulon truncatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact, evergreen shrub with upright stems and broad, waxy leaves. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and bloom in spring and summer. Trichocaulon truncatum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
